# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    transform!(df, :dt => x -> Dates.format.(x, "Ym") .=> :ym)
    return df
end
```

This function will modify the DataFrame `df` by adding a new column `ym`, which is created by formatting the `dt` column into the "yyyymm" format using Julia's Dates standard library and broadcasting the string transformation to every element in the `dt` column. The result will be an integer column as requested.
